"It's your lucky day, <charname>. Then again, when you work with us, every day is your lucky day.
"We stopped a messenger last week. Usually we don't mess with the Guards – why look for troubles? – but he was plainly dressed, so..." Cado shrugs. "He put up a fight and ended up with a bolt in his back. He didn't have much on him: a handful of coins and this rather pompously written "cease and desist, until further notice" document." He gives you a scroll with wooden rollers and several stamps.
"Apparently, Carrinas' superiors in Caer-Tor aren't very happy with his activities and feel that he's moving too fast. They are sending Gnaeus Laenas – yes, that Laenas – to evaluate the situation and put a leash on Carrinas, if necessary. Or assist him if the situation merits it."

"Carrinas would be a fool to pay attention to this letter or even to Laenas himself, but," Cado chuckles, "the rank and file should be appropriately intimidated if you play your part right."
He throws you the scroll. "It's all yours."

dlgPart.npc_text:
"Where does anything come from? The olden days. It's all about prestige. Everyone wants to show that we were *there*, that our blood is noble. As if anyone really cares.
"The way the story goes, ours is the oldest profession. What one man has, be it jewels, gold, or a shiny stone, another man wants. Such is the way of the world. And as this world grew, so too did we. We banded together, wrote our own laws, chose our leaders. We created a society within a society. We had our wars, of course – some differences can only be resolved with blood. We grew until there was one man controlling each city and forty men controlling the shadow society of the Empire."
"The War. Everything turned to shit. All we were left with was the name."

dlgAnsw.text: "What do you know about the war?"

dlgPart.npc_text: "The same thing everyone knows. There was a war with some devils from across the sea. That was the end of everything."
